Player History
Had first career hit (triple) on 4/5/1985, off Andy McGaffigan (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/17/1985, off Steve Carlton (PHI)...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 7/24/1985 (Going to LAD: 3B Mike Schmidt. Going to PHI: P Rick Honeycutt, P Tom Niedenfuer, 3B Scott Fletcher, 2B Steve Sax, RF Ralph Bryant)...
Injured on 8/24/1985 with a Strained Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,022,857 through salary arbitration...
7/28/1986: Signed a contract extension with Philadelphia, $3,890,000 per year, for 2 years.
8/25/1988: Signed a contract extension with Philadelphia, $2,890,000 per year, for 2 years.
9/1/1988: Signed a contract extension with Philadelphia, $2,890,000 per year, for 2 years.
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1988...
7/12/1990: Signed a contract extension with Philadelphia, $2,170,000 per year, for 2 years.
